usefulItems: bowl, baking tray (30 x 40 cm), baking paper, pastry brush, small bowl, oven
title: Mushroom-stuffed mushrooms

ingredients.content: 16 fresh cup mushrooms, brushed clean (stems removed and reserved)
½ bunch fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 190°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Hollow out the centre of each mushroom cap (reserving stems) to create space for filling and place, hollow-side up, onto baking tray.
Place almonds into mixing bowl and mill <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place butter and oil into mixing bowl and heat <b>1 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Transfer 2 tablespoons of the melted butter mixture into a small bowl and set aside.
Add eschalots, garlic, egg, parsley, nutmeg, salt, pepper and mushroom stems to mixing bowl and cook <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Add reserved grated Parmesan and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.

Brush each mushroom entirely with the reserved melted butter mixture and carefully spoon 1½ teaspoons of the mushroom mixture into each mushroom cap and sprinkle with reserved almonds. Place onto prepared tray and bake for 20 minutes (190°C - see Tip), until golden on top. Serve while warm.

hintsAndTricks: Cooking time may vary depending on the size of your mushrooms. We recommend using medium to large mushrooms for this recipe.
